Material used.Description: PC12/TetOn cells were cultured on disposable plasticware coated with poly-D-lysine at 37 °C, 5% CO2 in RPMI 1640 medium (Invitrogen) supplemented with 10% tetracycline-free horse serum (HS), 5% fetal calf serum (FCS) (Sigma Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA), 2 mM L-glutamine, 100UI/ml penicillin, and 100 mg/ml streptomycin (Invitrogen) in humidified atmosphere.

Readout description.Result Description: The inhibition of macroautophagy, but not the proteasome, led to an accumulation of the a-syn(WT) and the inhibition of macroautophagy and proteasome induced protein accumulation of a-syn(A30P). As for cell viability, the inhibition of macroautophagy increased cell toxicity stronger at doxycycline 1 µg/ml. In PC12/TetOn cells expressing the mutated A30P, both 3-MA and MG132 induced protein accumulation with a weak decrease of cell viability at doxycycline 1 µg/ml only.

Basic positive control.Description: Cells without any treatment were used as controls

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post-hoc test

Material used.Description: PC12/TetOn cells were cultured on disposable plasticware coated with poly-D-lysine at 37 °C, 5% CO2 in RPMI 1640 medium (Invitrogen) supplemented with 10% tetracycline-free horse serum (HS), 5% fetal calf serum (FCS) (Sigma Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA), 2 mM L-glutamine, 100UI/ml penicillin, and 100 mg/ml streptomycin (Invitrogen) in humidified atmosphere.

Readout description.Result Description: The inhibition of macroautophagy, but not the proteasome, led to an accumulation of the a-syn(WT) and the inhibition of macroautophagy and proteasome induced protein accumulation of a-syn(A30P). As for cell viability, the inhibition of macroautophagy increased cell toxicity stronger at doxycycline 1 µg/ml. In PC12/TetOn cells expressing the mutated A30P, both 3-MA and MG132 induced protein accumulation with a weak decrease of cell viability at doxycycline 1 µg/ml only.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post-hoc test

Readout description.Result Description: Alpha-synuclein expression level was quantified by Western blotting, using a-tubulin as internal standard.

Macroautophagy activation was evaluated by LC3-II immunocytochemistry. As positive control (CT+), we cultured mock-transfected PC12/TetOn cells for 18 h in absence of serum to induce starvation. We noticed macroautophagy activation, with the appearance of LC3-II-positive spots in serum-starved and doxycycline-induced cells, with a stronger reactivity for the a-syn(WT) form in comparison with the mutated A30P. We have also checked whether macroautophagy was activated by the addition of doxycycline 0.1 µg/ml for 48 h, but no positive LC3-II reactivity was found (data not shown).
